title: BontebOktoberfest puts brews and music in the wild
text:
BontebOktoberfest puts brews and music in the wild Andy Fitzpatrick , Battle Creek Enquirer 3:40 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 At Binder Park Zoo, where the annual craft beer tasting event known as BontebOktoberfest is about to return, adults will have a chance to have some fun. (Photo: CarlosAndreSantos, Getty Images/iStockphoto) Story Highlights BontebOktoberfest craft beer tasting night is from 6 to 10 p.m. Saturday at Binder Park Zoo Only those 21 or older may attend There will be live animal presentations and a carousel derby with prizes 16 CONNECT 2   
A trip to the zoo need not be only something to entertain the kids. 
At Binder Park Zoo, where the annual craft beer tasting event known as BontebOktoberfest is about to return, adults will have a chance to have some fun. 
“It’s a really great atmosphere,” zoo spokeswoman Kari Parker said. “The zoo makes a really great backdrop for an event like this in the evening for adults.” 
BontebOktoberfest, which serves as a fundraising event, runs 6-10 p.m. Saturday at the zoo, 7400 Division Drive. The event is named after the bontebok, an African antelope that also has a home at Binder Park Zoo. 
The bands Hey Monea and Seabird are scheduled to perform at the event, which also will feature grilled food from Taste of the Wild Catering, a commemorative glass to take home and shuttle service to Holiday Inn Battle Creek. 
Oh, and many of the craft breweries in southwestern Michigan will be represented. 
“It’s just kind of a unique place for people to come in, those who are beer enthusiasts, to be able to sample the wares from all of these different breweries,” Parker said. “It’s also great because they’re helping to support Michigan businesses as well.” 
Parker said several breweries will have their beer available, with representatives on hand. Names familiar to any craft beer fan make up the list: Dark Horse Brewing Co., Bell’s Brewery, New Holland Brewing, Founders Brewing Co. and several others are participating. 
A bontebok grazes on the Wild Africa savannah at Binder Park Zoo. (Photo: Enquirer file) 
The entry fee covers 12 drink tickets; wines and mead will also be available. For an extra cost, people can check out the VIP tent where different food and beer, and live sports on TV will be available. 
Arcadia Ales of Battle Creek and Kalamazoo will be there, and owner Tim Suprise said the brewery’s made up a batch of an Oktoberfest-style beer to go with the event. The beer also will be available for purchase in stores. 
Suprise said it’s a beer that’s very drinkable and good for those trying craft beer for the first time, which goes along with the Oktoberfest theme. 
“The Oktoberfest celebration in Germany is huge throughout the world,” Suprise said. “You get a number of people who are exposed to that festival the first time. The style that’s most often served is a beer that’s very approachable. It gets people that may be wine drinkers.” 
Suprise’s brewery is appearing at the event coming off some high recognition for its products. At the 2015 Great American Beer Festival in Denver, Arcadia’s India Pale Ale came away with the silver medal for its category. 
“That beer is my go-to beer and I think it’s just an extremely well-balanced IPA that got some recognition that I think it deserves,” Suprise said. 
Whatever one chooses to drink, Parker said the zoo is promoting drinking responsibly through cheaper designated driver tickets and offering the Holiday Inn shuttle service, where the zoo has made room packages available. 
And, Parker said, the breweries benefit from the night as well. 
“It gives them a little attention and exposure,” Parker said, “and it’s also helping bring people to the zoo that might not have otherwise come because they think grown ups can’t come to the zoo.”

If you go 
• WHAT: BontebOktoberfest craft beer tasting night. 
• WHERE: Binder Park Zoo, 7400 Division Drive. 
• WHEN: 6-10 p.m. Saturday. 
• COST: $45 per person before Saturday, $50 per person at the gate, $25 for designated drivers, $20 for the VIP tent (in addition to the regular ticket) before Saturday and $25 for the VIP tent at the gate. 
• INFO: There will be live animal presentations and a carousel derby with prizes. Only those 21 or older may attend. For more information, to buy tickets for find out more about hotel packages, go to www.binderparkzoo.org or call 979-1351. 16 CONNECT 2    //bcene.ws/1Lk3FRN More Stories
